comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Lord William Northrop McMillan (1872-1925), an American from St. Louis who had a huge ranch in Kenya, Juja Farm, and hosted Theodore Roosevelt there for some big game hunting. McMillan and his wife established the McMillan Library in Nairobi. He's buried near the peak of Mount Kilimambogo. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ol_Donyo_Sabuk

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: From The Ogden standard., March 27, 1915, 4 P.M. City Edition, Page 12 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn85058396/1915-03-27/ed-... "MILLIONAIRE ENLISTS. St. Louis, March 26. A cablegram received here tonight announced that William Northrup McMillan, millionaire St Louis druggist and mine owner with extensive estates in England and Africa, has enlisted in the British army as lieutenant. McMillan, the message said, had gone to join a regiment In Africa." Brief bio in The United States and Africa: A History books.google.com/books?id=dDwUFhl-4EMC&pg=PA214&l...

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: collections.mohistory.org/photo/PHO:38730 is another, more flattering, picture of him. and he and his wife are pictured in the frontispiece of a book about his big game hunting archive.org/stream/wnmcmillansexpe00jessgoog#page/n6/mode...

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of Feb 28, 1915 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9E01E7D81E3EE733A... reports that McMillan sailed for Europe on the Lusitania the previous day. Also on board were Mr. and Mrs. Lewisohn (neighboring photo).

comment.author: 11872175@N00
comment._content: He is the peak of Mount Kilimambogo.
